column4: hi all, is there a GUI way to edit startup OS menu....for grub2
well, using gedit is pretty good... as long as you know what you are doing :D
there is a command to make it autoupdate; however, I think the file is set as read-only
I would suggest making a "backup copy" of grub.cfg and then deleting it
so, a recap of everything I just said... 1: find the grub.cfg file 2: make a copy of the file 3: delete the original 4: run "sudo grub-mkconfig"
and of course, if it doesn't work, restore the original from the backup
ahh, I see what you want to do
well, someone decided to make the file "read-only" so you can't save :P
you can still copy the file and delete the file
so, make a "backup copy", then make a blank file of the same name "grub.cfg"
then from there, copy your original file into the new one
well, we need to make the file writable in order to change boot order
I would assume it goes by menu order
I would assume (I never used menuorder)
you would have to use VIM to edit it though
because gedit doesn't support writing over read-only files
